title: Beta regression in span printing with tabs involved

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

body:
This code (containing tabs) gives an error ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=7fbea34512455179a57ca244b297ba26&version=nightly)):

```rust
	let b = "hello";
	let _a = b + ", World!";
```

The error works fine on stable:

```
  |
3 |  let _a = b + ", World!";
  |           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ `+` can't be used to concatenate two `&str` strings
help: `to_owned()` can be used to create an owned `String` from a string reference. String concatenation appends the string on the right to the string on the left and may require reallocation. This requires ownership of the string on the left
  |
3 |  let _a = b.to_owned() + ", World!";
  |           ^^^^^^^^^^^^

```

But is mispositioned on rustc 1.25.0-nightly (73ac5d6a8 2018-01-11) as well as on rustc 1.24.0-beta.2 (a19122cfa 2018-01-10):

```
  |
3 |     let _a = b + ", World!";
  |              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ `+` can't be used to concatenate two `&str` strings
help: `to_owned()` can be used to create an owned `String` from a string reference. String concatenation appends the string on the right to the string on the left and may require reallocation. This requires ownership of the string on the left
  |
3 |     let _a = b.to_owned() + ", World!";
  |           ^^^^^^^^^^^^

```

cc @estebank
